definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
erhua variant of 搞花樣|搞花样[gao3 hua1 yang4]
erhua variant of 變樣|变样[bian4 yang4]

sentences.english: You can make a dress from this paper pattern.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这个纸样儿做一套衣服。

sentences.english: I ended up getting him one sample of nearly every item from the menu.
sentences.chinese: 我最后差不多每样儿给他买了一份回去。

sentences.english: She can just sit there and sings children's songs to Chloe for like an hour without repeating.
sentences.chinese: 她能坐在那给小克唱童谣唱上一个小时不带重样儿的。

sentences.english: The galley proof dares unarmed to dial my gun unexpectedly?
sentences.chinese: 小样儿的居然敢徒手来拨我的枪？

sentences.english: The styles of all the houses in this program are similar.
sentences.chinese: 该项规划中所有的房屋样儿都差不多。

sentences.english: These two pens are alike except that they're different colours.
sentences.chinese: 这两支笔样儿差不多，色儿不一样。

sentences.english: He is a good sort (of a fellow).
Mother Hucheloup, his wife, was a bearded and a very homely creature.
sentences.chinese: 他的老伴于什鲁大妈是个生着胡子模样儿怪丑的妇人。

sentences.english: We will generalize the question if we go on discussing this way.
sentences.chinese: 照咱们这样儿讨论下去，可就把问题泛化了。

sentences.english: I can't remember everything on it.
sentences.chinese: 我没法儿记住上面的每样儿东西。

sentences.english: Tell me, how does it turn ?
sentences.chinese: 告诉俺，这玩样儿是咋转弯滴？

definition: young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
way of doing sth/behavior/to act in an affected manner/mannerism/gestures in opera
to put on an attitude/to pose
erhua variant of 身板[shen1 ban3]
